pageContext.title: Early Americas Digital Archive
pageContext.description_excerpt: The Early Americas Digital Archive (EADA) is a collection of electronic texts and links to texts originally written in or about the Americas from 1492 to approximately 1820. Open to the public for research and teaching purposes, EADA was published and supported by the Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities (MITH) under the general editorship of Professor Ralph Bauer, at the University of Maryland at College Park.
pageContext.participants: Amit Kumar, Ann M. Hanlon, Eric White, Jarom McDonald, Ralph Bauer, Susan Schreibman, Tanya Clement
